title: Show blank dashboard until hardware connects and sends data

requirements.summary: Update the frontend dashboard to show a blank waiting state on all panels when hardware is not connected, polling the backend connection status every 3 seconds
acceptanceCriteria: When isHardwareConnected is false, all data panels are hidden and replaced with a 'Waiting for hardware connection...' placeholder
The placeholder uses the existing dark neon industrial theme (dark background, amber/cyan accent text, pulsing animation)
When isHardwareConnected becomes true, all dashboard panels render with live sensor data
Frontend polls isHardwareConnected every 3 seconds and automatically reveals panels without requiring a page refresh
The SimulationControl (manual advance) is also hidden in the waiting state so users cannot inject fake data before hardware connects

file_operations.description: Add a new React Query hook useHardwareConnectionStatus that wraps the backend isHardwareConnected() call with a 3-second polling interval (refetchInterval: 3000). Return the boolean connection status with loading and error states. This hook will be used by DashboardLayout to decide whether to show the waiting state or live data panels.

Import and call useHardwareConnectionStatus at the top of the component. When the connection status is false or loading, render a centered placeholder component (to be created) with a 'Waiting for hardware connection...' message, pulsing indicator, and industrial neon styling matching the existing theme. When the connection status is true, render all existing dashboard panels (header, simulation control, sensor/AI panels, energy flow diagram, analytics charts, footer) as they are today. Ensure the conditional rendering wraps the entire content area while keeping the overall layout structure intact.

Create a new React component that displays a centered waiting state UI with a 'Waiting for hardware connection...' message in the Orbitron font with amber glow, a pulsing animated indicator (e.g., a dot or icon), and a dark background matching the existing neon industrial theme. Use Tailwind utility classes from the existing theme (oklch colors, glow effects, pulse animation). The component should fill the available space and center its content both vertically and horizontally. Include a subtle scanline overlay effect consistent with the existing dashboard aesthetic.
